channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Very poor road surface, 10th January
item.description:
Very poor road surface in and around roundabout.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Norwood North Road East, The Reddings
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Subsidence, 10th January
item.description:
Edges of road in approach to bridge appear to be breaking off, reducing width of carriageway in (blind) approach to the bridge. Unsafe.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Badgeworth Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Suspected water leak, 10th January
item.description:
Seems to be water running across carriageway from industrial site.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 23 Bamfurlong Lane, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Road surface breaking up, 10th January
item.description:
Multiple patches on this section of road now falling apart making uneven surface in both carriageways. This will impede stopping distances near a junction and is not safe.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 9 Old Gloucester Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Very dangerous pothole. Tyre wrecked. Stuck waiting to be rescued., 10th January
item.description:
Hit a huge hole in the road in the dark. My nearside tyre znd wheel has been damaged.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Flight Farm Leckhampton Hill, Leckhampton Hill
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Very loose paving slab with no support or surround, 10th January
item.description:
This is one of a number of paving slabs that have been damaged on the pedestrianised section of the Promenade in Cheltenham, close to House of Fraser. Others have been repaired quickly and efficiently but this one is very loose and is a potential trip hazard. It is close to the Kuoni Travel Store

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Unit 3, 37 Promenade, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Redundant Road Works Signs been at Location for approx. 3 Months, 10th January
item.description:
The location is approx 10 yards into the Cleeve Common Road from the Burnt Oak Crossroads. The signs are approx 10 yards apart discarded on to the verge. They have been there about 3 months and subsequent road works in thet area have clearly ignored them and not collected them up. They have benn hit and driven over by vehicles and are clearly a road hazard. Please can they be collected up as soon as possible.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Sevenhampton
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Telecoms style tent left in situ for months, 10th January
item.description:
A red and white telecoms tent/shelter type thing has been left in situ for several months. It is now breaking down due to being left exposed to the weather for so long and needs removing.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Jubilee Farm Badgeworth Lane, Badgeworth
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Deep pothole, 10th January
item.description:
Deep pothole in the carriageway just before Mead Road.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 4 Mead Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Road Sweep, 10th January
item.description:
The road running through Elkstone Village needs a sweep. All the debris from the main road runs through the village and blocks up the drain covers. This causes problems. Thank you
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Elkstone
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 15inch pothole, 10th January
item.description:
This pothole has got worse with the freezing weather. The road is narrow and no space to dodge it. If you know the road you can preempt, if not it is dangerous and could damage your car.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Elkstone
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Potholes across Road, 10th January
item.description:
The location is the Cleeve Common Road just past the entrance to the Old Quarry / Dry Pool Farm. Two potholes have opened up - one either side of the road and right in the vehicle wheel tracks such that it is impossible to miss them. The road between the potholes also seems to be braking up to form a shallow 'trench' Please can these be filled in such that it stops the holes reopening as quite a few vehicles use this road.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Cleeve Common, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pot holes, 10th January
item.description:
2 Pot holes both directions bottom of Pecked Lane opposite Rectory court flats
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 45 Pecked Lane, Bishops Cleeve
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Hole still hasn't been filled in., 10th January
item.description:
Barriers are completely blocking the pavement. Come on GCC. Fix it, please!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 3 Hale's Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 2 large pot holes, 10th January
item.description:
Large pot holes outside number 6 and number 8 Linworth Road. The holes are that deep there is a lot of debris left over the road which keeps hitting our vehicles. These have been there since before Christmas but everytime they are filled they come out a few weeks later. This is by a school so the traffic is really bad and is causing a lot of damage now. We shouldn’t have to keep sweeping the pavement/road everyday. The road is bad and then flicks the stones up at my car and then it covered the pavement which is going to do a school child an injury sooner or later. Please sort
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 8 Linworth Road, Bishops Cleeve
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Crossing light going red every 30 seconds, 9th January
item.description:
Every 30 seconds the lights go red, the green man comes on without any button being pressed

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 1 Faringdon Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Stay Left Bollard no longer bolted down, 9th January
item.description:
The Stay Left Bollard protecting the crossing outside the Smith and Mann shop on Lyefield Road East with a blue arrow was knocked over approximately a year ago. It is the type where the bolts are designed to break on impact, it may be possible to replace the bolts without replacing the entire bollard and base. The brand name on it is "Visaboll" as in the photos. It is a thin and lightweight bollard and without the bolts when the wind blows it falls over.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 66 Copt Elm Road, Charlton Kings
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Gravel and large stones making pavement dangerous, 9th January
item.description:
The rocks and rubble from multiple pot holes has made the pavement dangerous, especially for the children going to primary school on micro scooters, prams, pushchairs ...
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 5 Church Street, Charlton Kings
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Very large deep pothole, 8th January
item.description:
A huge pothole has appeared in the road dangerous to cars and cyclists.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 138 Hewlett Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Two potholes due to failed repair last year, 8th January
item.description:
A previous pothole has been badly repaired and hence two for the price of one have emerged.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 2 Alma Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
